page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: A sleepy,quiet rural corner of North Yorkshire.At first sight little changed for many years.A closer look though shows up one busy village;that of Moulton;and part of another;Skeeby. As well as these typical Northern agricultural villages the area is cut almost into two halves by the very busy A-1 trunk road,a four lane dual carriageway along which heavy lorries race endlessly and an important North -South route for businessmen's cars and tourist traffic.Land use is one of mixed farming - grass and arable - with some woodland both deciduous and coniferous.The farmland is still very much a 'patchwork quilt' of fields.It is sparsely populated area containing, outside the village, only :-17 farms. In the villages themselves apart from houses are:- 3 churches,1 chapel, 1 Public House
